availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Monroe Bateman (Captain in the 2nd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, farmer, merchant, and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Newton Bateman and Margaret Bateman. Farmer in Mason County in 1850. Merchant in Mason County in 1860. Captain in the 2nd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) until February 7, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District 2, p. 65A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Minerva, p. 38.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 61.
Find A Grave, "Monroe Bateman (February 13, 1831-June 19, 1908)," Memorial #64228054, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/64228054 (accessed November 8, 2018).
